caption: The Church of Saint-Roch is a hidden gem in Paris, known for its beautiful Baroque architecture and serene atmosphere. Located on Rue Saint-Honoré, this historic church features stunning altars, intricate sculptures, and impressive artwork. The grand interior, with its high vaulted ceilings and peaceful chapels, provides a tranquil retreat from the bustling city outside. Notably, the church has strong artistic and historical ties, having been frequented by artists and musicians throughout its history. Whether you're seeking a quiet moment of reflection or admiring the artistry, the Church of Saint-Roch is a lovely and lesser-known treasure in Paris.

A hidden gem in the middle of Paris. Despite being so unkept and badly maintained you can still enjoy the historical and magnificent art that draws you closer to our Lord. It’s sad to see it’s deterioration. However, it’s true beauty still comes across and forces you to imagine of what once was.

The altar of this church is a sight to behold!  I came to this church on a whim when in Paris. I was in the area and decided to enter during mass. It was a brilliant thing to experience, even if I know absolutely no French!

Very old and big church. Churches are usually very cool inside especially on a very hot summerday, this one was very good to just cool down and relax. The church itself is very beautiful, you can see they dont have the funds to really renovate but the building is huge and so pretty. Absolutely a secret tip :)

Lovely, relatively small active Catholic Church.  Built in the 17th and 18th in a French Baroque and classical style.  Lovely interior with some amazing chapels that includes on with a version of the Jewish Ark of the Covenant.  Not wheelchair accessible.

So gorgeous inside and out! The stained glass and art inside are worth a stop. Free to enter respectfully. Ask a local or Google about the history of Napolean and this church. Apparently it has quite a bloody history in the French Revolution.
Napoleon fought here.  The funeral of fashion Yves Saint Laurent was held here too!  Lots of art students inside sketching when we were there.  Informational placards inside
On Sundays there is an authentic unsimplified Latin Mass here.
Beautiful church with less crowds. The life size paintings take you back in time. There are descriptions as well to provide information.
The Church service is in French and was very nice.  The church is a hidden gem with lots to see inside.
Very nice and big church close to Louvre. Good place to reflect and pray from the hustle and bustle of a large metropolis.
Stumbled in by chance but it took my breath away! Great Baroque style architecture, stunning sculptures and paintings on the wall. Definitely worth a visit.
Église Saint-Roch is a church in the French Baroque and Classical style. It was built in the 17th and 18th centuries. Located in the 1st arrondissement of Paris.

Fascinating church dedicated to Saint Roch. It's in the middle of the busy, trendy and fashionable Saint-Honoré street so it's a nice surprise to get a dose of French history amidst the storefronts boasting Dior and Goyard. It's an operational church so they offer mass. Make sure to check out the stunning altarpiece.
A beautiful church near Tuileries gardens
Beautiful calm church.
Mass was lit, really enjoyed it and felt God's presence in this beautiful place

Not exactly a very popular church, and a bit dark and empty inside. Entrance was free (as of August 2023). There are some interesting statues and paintings found inside. Worth a visit if you're in the area, but I wouldn't make a trip just to visit it.
A small church nearby the hotel that I was staying.
Organ music filled the place and even beckoned us from the street.  Overall the top church definitely Romanesque and beautifully restored.
Beautiful baroque church, not overcrowded, worth to see it. Particularly pipes are impressive.
An off the beaten path church.   There's a lot of history here!   There are so many beautiful artifacts inside.
Such a beautiful church, centrally located. We attended Palm Sunday mass as visitors and were warmly welcomed. The priest was genuine and the choir heavenly. Very memorable.
Good for quick tour if in the area shopping.

Discovered this church by accident and was blown away by the interior.  It is large. The artwork is extraordinary and I liked the way it was illuminated and explained at the entrance and related to the Bible passages in both in French and English. The focal point at the end of the church is very meditative. Well worth a look
The seventh of the churches we visited. Looks old quiet and less visited by tourists but it is conducive for praying and medidation away from the noise and commotion of visitors.

A great church to visit, but to enhance your visit consider taking in a concert while you are there. We saw gospel dream and to hear such beautiful voices in an old space designed to amplify sound was an experience!

This church is in the center of Paris & open to the public during the day. Built in the 1500's it shows wear & tear especially on the doors which makes me like it even more but the organ is intact & is spectacular !

We stumbled upon this 17th century baroque church while waiting for our Giverny trip. After short prayers,  we marveled at the murals and sculptures which, though not famous, were as beautiful and as historical as those in Notre Dame. And then... and then... suddenly  we heard celestial voices seemingly emanating from its walls (as the church seemed empty without us).

What a lovely place to visit in Paris. Probably not in many tourist guides so it was quiet Lovely to photograph but I didn't break my rule of photographing inside religious sites. Left a nice donation.

Stumbled onto this church by accident. Had no idea what it would unfold once entered, and waw it did not disappoint. After literally wandering into here, I sat for a good while just taking in the astonishing architecture, then walked around to fully take in the whole place. Just jaw-dropping dedication and investment. Would totally recommend it to anyone in the area.
Very nice church
Beautiful traditional mass (extraordinary form) for the feast of the Ascension. Excellent homily.
Beautiful and full of art
Not too impressive on the exterior but inside it is AMAZING!  Definitely worth a walk through and not the crowds that you get at Notre Dame.
Welcoming and beautiful baroque Church in the heart of Paris, definitely worth a visit - especially if you can attend Mass
One of the most exclusive little church in Paris but where the accoustic is the best for a Gospel concert
One of the symbolic churhes in Paris date back from 18 century. Very near to Louvre museum.
